title: Use uploaded image in the Yes-click reveal screen

requirements.text: Update the post-‚ÄúYes‚Äù reveal view to display the user-uploaded image ("WhatsApp Image 2026-02-07 at 8.14.44 PM.jpeg") instead of the current static meme image, while keeping the existing reveal message text unchanged.

quotes: after he says yes this image should pop up

acceptanceCriteria: When the user clicks the ‚ÄúYes! üíï‚Äù button, the reveal view shows the uploaded image instead of `/assets/generated/valentine-meme.dim_1200x800.png`.
The reveal message text remains exactly: ‚Äúyou rejected me 11 years ago today for the first time and look at you now wanting to have babies with me ü•∞ ‚Äù.
The uploaded image is stored as a static frontend asset and is loaded directly by the frontend (no backend calls).
The reveal image remains responsive (fits the card width on mobile/iPad/desktop without overflowing) and preserves the existing rounded/shadow styling.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, `frontend/src/components/ui`.
Do not add backend dependencies or implement backend logic for serving the image; the image must be a static frontend asset.
nonGoals: Changing the Valentine question text or the Yes/No interaction mechanics.
Adding Internet Identity login or any authentication changes.
Creating new animations beyond what already exists in the reveal view.
